definition: delighted/with great joy/in high spirits
joyous/happy/pleased
day/sky/heaven
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: They have been walking on air since they won the first prize.
sentences.chinese: 自從贏得首獎後，他們一直都是歡天喜地的。

sentences.english: The children are extremely delighted when Christmas comes.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節來臨的時候，孩子們歡天喜地的。

sentences.english: I sing out loud and merrily.
sentences.chinese: 我就要放聲歌唱，歡天喜地。

sentences.english: Lark in sky merrily merrily merrily to welcome in the Year.
sentences.chinese: 天上的雲雀，滿心喜悅，歡天喜地，迎接新年到。

sentences.english: We’re extremely delighted at your success.
sentences.chinese: 我們因爲你的成功而歡天喜地。

definition: to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
to smash
happily
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
crying tears of joy (idiom)
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to console
